Dear Ms. Berkobien:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was denied medical attention during a crisis situation.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed over the phone on 08/13/2024
and had no other information to provide.
Emergency Medical Personnel was interviewed over the phone
on 08/13/2024. He stated he was one of the medical personnel
that was called to the facility on the date of 07/07/2024. He stated
he had been called out for a youth that had climbed up on top of a
building and was threatening to jump off. Emergency Medical
Personnel recalled there was not a youth on top of a roof when he
arrived, but there were two youth escalated and outside of the
building with staff attending to them. He stated he turned his
attention to a youth that was walking toward the road with staff
near him. This youth appeared under the influence to the medical
personnel. He was not responding verbally to anyone; his facial
features seemed relaxed and had a “thousand yard stare.”
Emergency Medical Personnel recalled the youth was not
attempting to harm himself or the staff near him. Emergency
Medical Personnel did not believe staff were going to be able to
stop the youth from continuing to walk off of the property He then
got approval from a superior to administer a sedative to the youth,
and when Emergency Medical Personnel communicated this to
the staff, he was met with resistance. The staff stated to
Emergency Medical Personnel they did not believe providing the
sedative to the youth was necessary, and they did not believe the
youth was under the influence of any drugs. Emergency Medical
Personnel stated the staff eventually talked the youth into going
back towards the building, and he then turned his attention to the
other escalated youth outside. He confirmed that a sedative was
never provided to Youth A. Emergency Medical Personnel could
not recall any names of the youth or staff with which he interacted,
2

but he did confirm he had not met this youth before from other
interactions with the facility.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/06/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He recalled the incident in
question and confirmed he was walking outside of the facility with
staff following him. Youth A could not recall why he was outside or
what his state of mind was at that time. He also could not recall
which staff was interacting with him and if there was law
enforcement or medical staff present. Youth A stated he was
never under the influence of drugs during his time placed at the
facility.
The facility Chief Administrator was interviewed on 09/06/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. In
reviewing the incident on the date in question she confirmed that
law enforcement and emergency medical personnel were called to
the facility to assist with Youth B after he climbed up on top of a
roof and threatened to jump off, and that this call had nothing
specific to do with Youth A at that time. The Chief Administrator
confirmed that Youth A and Youth B were the only two youth
outside of the building at that time.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/11/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. He recalled the incident in
question and stated he was outside and interacted separately with
both Youth A and Youth B. At the time Youth A was walking
outside of the building and was heading towards the road that is
the boundary of the facility’s property, but never made it that far.
Youth A appeared to be upset, was not talking, and despite not
listening to requests to come back inside he was not attempting to
hurt others or himself. Staff 1 heard one of the emergency
medical personnel comment they were concerned Youth A was
under the influence of illicit drugs. Staff 1 saw the medical
personnel prepare a sedative shot for Youth A. As this was
occurring Staff 1 was attempting to verbally de-escalate Youth A,
asking him to verbalize how he was feeling. Staff 1 recalled Youth
A turning around to walk towards the building on his own and
without staff’s physical intervention. At this point, Emergency
Medical Personnel then turned their attention toward Youth B and
Youth A continued to walk back inside with other staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 10/09/2024. Staff 2
recalled Youth A walking away from the building and towards the
road during the incident in question. Youth A was not verbal and
was not attempting to run or hurt himself or others but was also
3

not listening to staff attempting to talk him into going back inside
the building. Staff 2 recalled one of the emergency medical
personnel stating they believed Youth A was under the influence
of illicit drugs. Staff 2 stated back he did not believe this was the
case, and there was no evidence that Youth A could have
consumed any drugs at any point prior to this point in time. When
Staff 2 heard the medical personnel refer to the need to administer
a sedative to Youth A, he replied back that was not going to be
necessary as staff could continue to attempt to verbally de-
escalate the youth and provide line of sight supervision. Staff 2
believed this recommendation came up too quickly in their
interactions with Youth A, and after some time Youth A began to
walk back to the building without incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 10/09/2024. He
recalled being a part of the incident in question. He stated he was
with Youth A as Youth A was walking the grounds of the facility
immediately before Youth B’s escalation. Staff 3 recalled Youth A
being upset and not listening to staff interacting with him. Staff 3
described Youth A’s affect as flat, and he was crying as he walked
around. Youth A was not attempting to harm himself or others
and he was not verbally aggressive. Staff 3 recalled medical
personnel verbalizing they were prepared to administer a sedative
to Youth A, and Staff 2 stating to them that this was not
necessary. Staff 3 did not hear more of that exchange because
he turned his attention to Youth B at that time.
Documents Reviewed:
• Facility policy titles “Emergency and Routine
Medical/Dental Care Policy and Procedure” last dated
07/12/2020 was provided and reviewed. This policy stated
that 911 is to be contacted and youth are to be transported
to the hospital via emergency personnel if emergency
medical care is needed. The policy did not provide detail
on what was to occur if emergency medical personnel are
on campus interacting with youth.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence
found that the facility did not ensure that Youth A received
necessary medical services, assessing that they were able to de-
escalate the youth without medical restraint.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
4

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to
a youth's background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff used derogatory language towards a youth during a crisis
situation.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed over the phone on 08/13/2024
and had no other information to provide.
Emergency Medical Personnel was interviewed over the phone
on 08/13/2024. He stated he arrived at the facility and interacted
with one youth that was wandering the front grounds with staff
members, and then turned his attention to another youth. This
second youth was interacting with staff and law enforcement at
the time. Emergency Medical Personnel recalled this youth as
very escalated, and at one point the youth appeared to reach for
the firearm on one of the law enforcement officers. This caused
law enforcement to restrain the youth, and the youth was
eventually placed in a soft mechanical restraint on a stretcher to
be transported to a local hospital by the medical staff. Emergency
Medical Personnel confirmed that staff did not take part in these
restraints or transportation. Emergency Medical Personnel did
recall one specific staff member reacted significantly when the
youth did this, yelling “What the fuck are you doing!” Emergency
Medical Personnel believed this was directed at the youth.
Emergency Medical Personnel then addressed this staff member,
stating to him it was inappropriate to speak to the youth in that
manner. Emergency Medical Personnel believed the staff
member used profanity directed back at himself. This staff
member then walked away as Emergency Medical Personnel
5

helped secure the youth and load the stretcher into the
ambulance.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/11/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 1 confirmed he was present
and with Youth B during the incident on the date in question. He
recalled this occurring on a Sunday and Youth B began to get
upset after church and eventually left the building and went
outside. Staff 1 recalled Youth B climbing on top of a rooftop and
threatening to jump off, and he was talked into coming back down
by staff. At this point Youth B was still escalated and law
enforcement and emergency medical personnel arrived at the
facility. Staff 1 recalled the emergency medical personnel first
interacted with Youth A. Youth A was outside of the building also,
but not interacting with Youth B and was some distance away.
After Youth A began to walk back to the building, Staff 1 recalled
turning his attention back to Youth B, who was then interacting
with law enforcement and emergency medical personnel. At that
time the emergency medical personnel already had a stretcher
prepared and were readying to take Youth B to the hospital to
have a psychiatric assessment performed. Staff 1 saw then make
a move that looked like he was trying to grab the firearm off of the
side of one of the law enforcement officers. Staff 1 saw law
enforcement then restrain Youth B to the ground. Staff 1 stated
that he yelled out to Youth B “What the fuck are you doing!” Staff
1 recalled feeling fear and concern for what Youth B was
attempting to do at that moment as he had been escalated and
acting out of his normal behavior. He believed he had a good
rapport with Youth B and was surprised by this sudden escalation
in unsafe behavior. Staff 1 recalled one of the emergency medical
personnel stating back to him “Don’t yell at the kid.” Staff 1
recalled talking with the emergency medical personnel at that
point as law enforcement moved Youth B to the stretcher and
handcuffed him to it, then loaded him into the ambulance.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 09/23/2024. He
recalled the incident in question. Youth B remembered getting
upset after a church service and he eventually made his way
outside, climbing on top of a garage roof and threatening to jump
off. Youth B recalled climbing down from the garage after staff
talked him into it, but he remembered he was still upset. He
believed this was when the ambulance and law enforcement
arrived. Youth B was asked by law enforcement to come with
them and get in the ambulance, and he refused. It was then that
law enforcement attempted to put Youth B in handcuffs and Youth
B fought back with them. He recalled hearing a lot of people
6

raising their voices at this point but could not recall anything
specific anyone said or who was talking. Youth B admitted to
attempting to grab the firearm of one of the officers, who then
proceeded to take him to the ground. As this occurred Youth B
recalled hearing Staff 1 state “What the fuck are you doing!”
Youth B recalled hearing one of the emergency medical personnel
then state “You can’t talk to him like that” back to Staff 1. Youth B
stated that he was then placed on a stretcher and transported
from the facility by the medical personnel.
Staff 3 was interviewed over the phone on 10/09/2024. He
recalled being a part of the incident in question. Staff 3 stated his
involvement started with attempting to talk Youth B off of the top of
a garage where he had climbed up and threatened to jump off.
Staff 3 stated this was successful, but Youth B was still escalated
when he climbed down. At this time Youth B walked toward the
road of the facility and was intercepted by law enforcement and
emergency medical personnel. Staff 3 recalled Youth B
immediately displaying escalated behavior towards them, yelling
that he was not going to be sedated and not going with them. As
he physically engaged with law enforcement, Staff 3 saw Youth B
attempt to grab the firearm of one of the officers. Staff 3 stated
Youth B was then taken to the ground by the officer. Staff 3
stated everyone present was yelling and surprised as this
occurred, including the officers and medical personnel. Staff 3
recalled hearing Staff 1 yell “What the fuck are you doing!”
towards Youth B among all the commotion. Staff 3 remembered
the medical personnel getting upset at Staff 1, but their
conversation was between each other as Youth B was secured to
a stretcher and loaded into the ambulance.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation dated 07/07/2024 was
reviewed. Details in this documentation matched
interviews provided by youth and staff.
• Facility policy titled “Behavior Management Policy and
Procedure” last dated 07/01/2024 was provided and
reviewed. This policy stated that prohibited acts towards
youth placed included “yelling, threats and swearing at
persons served.”
7

Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed. There was evidence
found that staff at the facility subjected Youth B to verbal abuse
during the incident, as defined in the rule.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
